headline: Black Bean Hummus
description: This hummus comes with raves attached to it. Everything goes into the food processor and is swooshed into a fabulous consistency. Try it with some toasted pita bread.
name: Black Bean Hummus
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans; drain and reserve liquid

recipeInstructions.text: Mince garlic in the bowl of a food processor. Add black beans, 2 tablespoons reserved liquid, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, tahini, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper; process until smooth, scraping down the sides as needed. Add additional seasoning and liquid to taste. Garnish with paprika and Greek olives.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make…I love garlic so I added three cloves….I used it as a spread on my wraps.

I’ve made this several times, switching things up until I got it to my liking. Not to be “that guy” but hummus is garbanzo, so technically this is not a hummus recipe, it’s a black bean dip. I did not care for the flavor of the olives so left those out after using them the first time. I doubled the cumin and cayenne and added a tablespoon of chili crisp to spice it up. I like my version so will stick with it.
Maybe just using black beans is too earthy a taste for me but I didn’t think it worked. I added significantly more tahini, lemon juice and salt to make it slightly palatable.
Super easy and delicious recipe just as it is! no modifications needed. Forgot to add the kalamata olive garnish - will do that next time!
I liked the change up - the greek olives I blended into the mix and added oil packed sun dried tomatos and fresh cilantro. Good recipe very flexible.

Excellent!! This is the first hummus I have ever made but seeing it was black bean made me want to try it. It is ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! My son watched me make it and tasted a some and immediately asked for the recipe. Definitely a keeper!

Found this after looking for recipes to incorporate more legumes in my pregnancy diet. Didn't have olives or cayenne, tahini, and it was a great! The second time, I made it without the cumin and garlic (as it adds a bit too strong of a spice), and it was good as well. It's better if you let it sit overnight, and good with carrot and cucumber sticks. Definitely add more lemon juice if you want more a taste to it.
Delicious!! SOOOO GOOD!!
Live this recipe. I doubled the recipe and added 1 large chopped jalapeño. It was amazing!
Amazing hummus! Love how this recipe tastes I make it at least once a month. I mix the olives in the hummus and friends like the surprise.
Nice Veggie Black Bean Hummus! I Love It!

My 16 month old LOVES hummus so when I ran out of garbanzo beans, I tried this black bean variation. It was delicious!! I actually prefer it to the traditional hummus I had been making. I creamed the lemon juice and tahini first and then added in everything except the beans. Lastly added in the beans and this made it extra creamy. A little olive oil at the end. My toddler ate a whole bowl of it! Only thing I left out was the cayenne. Will definitely make again!
I added 2 Tbsp of each: lemon juice, tahini, olive oil. I also chopped some kalamata olives to sprinkle on top with a little drizzle of olive oil.
Perfect dip for my vegetables!
Yum! Made it without tahini, used coconut oil ... What I had.

This has become a staple for me. Very healthy 'go to' quick food option. Currently eating with Ritz Toasted Chips Veggie flavor. 
I Make every 2 or 3 days...I wouldn't keep it more than 2 days. Follow this recipe, only thing I change is using the juice of 1 whole lime.
Initially saw this recipe in No Meat Athlete book
Fantastic hummus - and so easy to make. And lower fat that other hummus because it doesn't contain olive oil

In my hurry to make this recipe I missed the part about using olives and paprika to garnish it. I didn't have any Greek olives so I used black olives right in the mix with the hummus. At this point I would suggest salting to taste because black olives are quite salty. I also used half lime and half lemon juice as some other reviewers had suggested. My kids won't normally eat hummus but they gobbled this down and I made a double batch. It was absolutely delicious. Keep in mind the season to taste bit because we used a little bit of extra cumin and paprika as well. This is definitely a keeper. It keeps the saturated fats down below what I'm allowed in my diet and has many other really good nutrients. It was so yummy too.

only things I did different were 1) did not read directions before making so put the olives in the food processor with everything else and 2) left out the cayenne and put black pepper. It was good if a bit bland. I will add the cayenne next time! note - I really could not notice the olive taste even though they were blended in the dip.

This "Black Bean Hummus" had a nice creamy texture. The olive flavor was more pronounced with time. Mine still tasted "fresh" after 10 days. I wouldn't hesitate to make it again. Thank you Jen for sharing your recipe.
No tahini in the house
Yummy!!
Flat out delicious—I want to try as a sandwich spread with a grilled chicken breast and some pepper jack cheese.
Simply fantastic!

Very good. Very easy to change the ingredients to your taste.
I added a little Braggs Cider Vinegar and a small chipotle pepper for a little extra snap.
Served it with thin wheat crackers. Was all gone in minutes.
I live chick peas but bought way too many cans of black beans so gave this recipe a go. It’s got a really nice earthy flavor. Fam loved it too!

Yummy. Needed to take an appetizer to a pot luck and chose this. I cooked my own black beans the day before. Because some people don't like a lot of spice, I cut the cayenne pepper to 1/8th teaspoon. After tasting I also upped the lemon juice a little...maybe another tablespoon and drizzled a little olive oil in. Turned out great. Will serve with pita chips and some cut up veggies.
the best hummus I've ever had! try drizzling truffle oil, and crumbled feta on top mmmmmm
The best hummus I've ever had. I made this recipe for myself and my college roommates and they all loved it. I cranked up the amount of lemon juice
A good change of pace but seemed more like a Mexican bean dip than a hummus. Using the leftovers as a burrito filling for dinner tonight.
The recipe was fine but I rather make my hummus from Garbanzo Bean. This was a little hot for my taste.
it was very tasty. i added a little extra cayenne pepper for a little extra kick
it was very tasty. i added a little extra cayenne pepper for a little extra kick
Delicious. I used chili powder instead of cayenne because it’s what I had. I recommend making it just as directed, then you can adjust for a little more spice if you like, but it is excellent as is.
Love this! What a great variation on traditional hummus!

I added .2 tablespoons of olive oil 
 Delicious
Yummy! It feels like a rich high calorie food but it’s not. Went great with both pita chips and veggies.
I don't add the salt for health reasons. But this is a delicious recipe. With just a little kick. Definitely going to make again.

This was delicious! I used lime juice instead of lemon because that was what I had on hand. My husband said best hummus he has ever eaten. I made another batch as soon as I made the first because I knew it would be gone!
I'm always trying to get more fiber and this was a great way to do it. The greek olives really made this dish for us. We ate with raw veggies .

I've made this several times, leaving out the olives. I like this recipe and use it often because it is simple. I understand that without the olives or olive oil the consistency may be a little different than traditional hummus, but I like the lower oil content.
Very nice. Not a real big fan of heat so I reduced the amount of cayenne by half. Also omitted the cumin as I don’t care for it.
I used 2 tlbs of tahini, and 1/2 tsp for each seasoning. Delicious!
yum! very salty
I made this exactly as written except I doubled the garlic. Delicious!
Best ever, but not as good when cold, so eat right after you make it.
I brought this to a party and I got several compliments on it and questions about what was in it. But more importantly, I LOVE IT too!
This was fantastic! Everyone loved it, no substitutes!
My family and I love this! We make it regularly, and bring it to get togethers. I get asked to make this by friends that don’t like garbanzo beans/chickpeas. Great stuff!
Was very good! I don't really care for chickpeas so this was a great alternative. Great flavor, this recipe is a keeper.

I love black beans and love hummus, so what's not to like? This is delicious, tasty, and healthy. I do agree that it might just taste like a black bean dip if you don't put enough lemon juice in. I feel like the tahini is an important ingredient also, so I didn't skimp there. I agree that doubling the amount of spices makes for a more flavorful dish. I love it with Trader Joe's Bite Size Everything Crackers. I'll surely be making this numerous times!
So delicious. Not sure it's going to make it to the Super Bowl party. It may be gone by then!
The fam loved it.

I added another can of black beans as this was a bit spicy. I also used peanut butter because I was out of tahini and used 3 minced garlic cloves and 1 tbsp olive oil. Turned out delicious and better than store bought! Just added more beans due to the spice. Great recipe!

This was so good that I immediately made a second batch. The only change I made the second time around is that I blended 6 Greek kalamata olives right into the hummus. Either way, it's a tasty and very healthy recipe.
I didn't love it but it was good. Little bland.
No changes made...this stuff is awesome!!!!
Whipped this up before going to work! Fast, easy and tasty! I’ll make it again!

Unlike a few other reviews, mine had too much liquid (and made in blender). If I try again, I'll leave out the reserved liquid to get more of humus texture. Flavor was OK but think I'd kick it up a notch.
The whole family loved it! I made mine with freshly cooked black beans instead of canned. Also used lime juice instead of lemon. You won't be disappointed!

this was really good.. i doubled the garlic and cumin as suggested by RALWATTAR.. but cut the cayenne in half (not wanting it to be overly spicy) i added olive oil in place of the canned liquid like AWO and also left out the tahini.. didn't garnish with olives and added the paprika (doubled) along with the other spices.. we enjoyed this with sliced cucumber, baby carrots, and tortilla chips.. bf says he likes this version better than the chickpea one.. i agree.. ty for the recipe

I was looking to make use of the black beans in the pantry. I made the recipe as stated with one exception; I used 2 cloves of garlic instead of 1 (I love garlic) and it's fantastic. I have paprika from Hungary that gave it a nice kick.
Nice kick and creamy texture.
Delicious!
I made this with some left over black beans. I also added coriander, chili garlic paste and fresh cilantro. Iuse lime juice instead of lemon. This recipe is awesome, waybetter than traditional hummus
I love it! thank you:)
Delicious! Made it just like the recipe says. Didn't garnish it. We loved it and so has everyone we've shared it with.
I really enjoyed this hummus! The addition of cumin gave it a nice flavor. I can see myself snacking with this on veggies and pita chips often. Thank you!

This is good, but everyone's tastes are different. I doubled the garlic, so that was perfect. I'll cut the olives in half for next time, it tasted too "olivey". I actually got my picky wife to eat some...and she liked it!
Great as written! A bit better with a couple of tsps toasted sesame seed oil thrown in. Tang it up a bit with a bit of malt vinegar, too.

I needed an appetizer to bring to a girlfriend gathering. This was quick and delicious! Everybody raved about it and appreciated that it was healthy (I served it with cut peppers, celery, carrots and Sandwich Thins cut in triangles). I didn't have Tahini, so I just used ground up toasted sesame seeds and robust OVOO and I added some extra garlic. I garnished it with chopped olives and chopped fresh chives. So good!
I doubled the amount of cayenne for alittle more kick and also added 4oz. of sun dried tomatos. Awesome.

Instead of canned black beans I used dry beans prepared according to directions. My dip resulted in a beautiful lavender color, not what I expected but who cares! Since I didn't use canned beans I think it could use a little more salt. Otherwise this recipe rocks. I like spicy food so I will add more spice to taste. What a great way to get your fiber.

I had black bean hummus at Gloria Estefan's restaurant Bongos and it was delicious. Tried this recipe and wow.... very good! I did use two small garlic cloves and in this recipes a bit over powering. Next time I will stick to the recipe can't wait to try other hummus recipes now that I have a 16 oz bottle of tahini!!!
Added olive oil to improve consistency, and some mustard and balsamic vinegar to spice it up a bit.
Very good

This was amazing! Everyone loved it and it was perfect for my picky 10 year old who needs to eat more protein and who doesn't like meat. Make sure to use fresh garlic. Also I used Kalmata olives rather than green Greek olives which made for an interesting flavor. This will be a recipe I make often.
This was a yummy, simple recipe. I added some fresh jalapeno to the dish for a little spice!
Would give 5 but need to cut back on salt next time. But good and want to make again.
This recipe is perfect!

This recipe is AMAZING !!! I added some of the bean cooking liquid for smoothness, bumped up the spices and used 1/2 lime 1/2 lemon just cuz. I also doubled the recipe, seeing how I made it once before and knew how delicious it was... next time I will make it in 2 batches as even my vitamix was working a little too hard...
It was Ok. Nothing really special.

This black bean hummus was so easy to make. We love it and will definitely make it again. I made it exactly as the recipe called for. The only thing I would change next time is 1/2 the salt if serving with chips. Perfect as is for dipping veggies! Thank you for sharing this recipe!

wow! Absolutely delicious! I have just started liking hummus and a friend at work said she wished she could try black bean hummus so I did a search and found this recipe. I can't wait to take this to work tomorrow; if I don't eat it all tonight! I have some pico de gallo to enjoy with it.
One of my go to snack thangs....I use Indian chili powder instead of cayenne....

Very yummy, one of the guests asked for the recipe. To me, tasted pretty much like standard hummus... But it was cool that I made it myself :) Maybe next time I'll add some more garlic since I like it a little zestier.

This was so ugly that I had to sell the idea of eating it to a group of people. No one was attracted to GRAY food. If I hadn't tasted it and known it was quite tasty, I couldn't have eaten it, either. One family member loved it and ate most of it, but everyone else eyed it suspiciously and left it alone.

We made a double batch for a potluck and served it with pita type bread, dolmas, dates, and olives. I skipped the salt, but with the double batch, I think using the amount of salt for one batch may have given it a little more oomph.
I just made this and it was amazing. I did not have Greek olives so I used 5 black olives and 5 regular olives and just added to mix. Did not drain beans. Perfect consistency.
Left out the Greek olives because I don't like them. Next time I will probably cut the amount of cayenne in half as it is a bit spicy. Other than that, it is DELICIOUS!!!

made as the recipe stated and really wasn't my favorite humus, but I may not be a fan of black bean humus and this is the first time I have had. my nieces were over and they loved it but wanted more garlic. so after adding more garlic to it they ate he entire thing. it was good just not my favorite, again could just be my taste.
I have made these several times and it's a hit every time. This last time I added some corn relish which was also delicious!
Awe some!
I agree with RALWATTAR - thank you for your post! I doubled the spices and the lemon juice and it came out perfect. Otherwise I imagine this would have been rather bland.
I make hummus most every week and just made this today. It is absolutely delicious. No changes made.
Super easy and super yummy. Brought into work the next day had the girls loved it. Serve with pita chips or veggies and it's great!
I've made this several times, each time adding pineapple chunks to the mix in the food processor. The added sweetness is perfect!
I would add less paprika otherwise this is a great black bean houmos!

Delicious. I didn't have QUITE enough lemon juice (maybe short 1/2 a tsp) but it was fine, the garlic and spices make it sufficiently flavourful. Had to add a couple extra tbsp of liquid for it to blend well in my Magic Bullet so definitely keep the reserved liquid just in case. Will happily make again!
